summary.purpose: Provides a versatile Badge component for displaying small status indicators, labels, or tags with multiple visual variants and styling support.
summary.problem_solved: Offers a reusable, styled badge element with configurable variants (default, secondary, destructive, outline) for consistent status and label display across the application.

external.name: class-variance-authority
external.why_used: CVA library for managing component variant styles declaratively. Used to define multiple badge styling variants with proper TypeScript support.

external.name: react
external.why_used: Core React library for component creation, props typing (HTMLAttributes), and JSX rendering

internal.why_used: Provides the cn() utility function for conditionally merging CSS classes and variant classes

exports.name: Badge
exports.description_one_line: React component rendering a styled badge element with variant support

exports.name: badgeVariants
exports.description_one_line: CVA variant configuration function for badge styling with all available variants

symbols.name: BadgeProps
symbols.description_one_line: Props interface extending HTML div attributes with badge-specific variant options

details.what_it_does: Extends React HTMLAttributes<HTMLDivElement> with VariantProps from CVA badgeVariants. Allows consumers to pass standard HTML div attributes plus the badge variant prop for styling customization.

symbols.name: badgeVariants
symbols.description_one_line: CVA variant configuration defining all badge styling variants and defaults

returns.description: CVA variant function that returns CSS classes based on variant prop

details.what_it_does: CVA (class-variance-authority) configuration that defines the base badge styles and four variant styles: 'default' (primary blue background), 'secondary' (secondary background), 'destructive' (red warning background), and 'outline' (text only, no background). Base styles include flex layout, rounded corners, padding, small text, semibold font, transitions, and focus ring styling.

minimal_correct.title: Using badgeVariants directly

extensive_correct.title: All badge variants with badgeVariants

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using invalid variant
incorrect.why_incorrect: badgeVariants only accepts 'default', 'secondary', 'destructive', or 'outline' as variant values. TypeScript will prevent invalid variants at compile time.

symbols.name: Badge
symbols.description_one_line: Badge component rendering a styled inline-flex element with text content and variant support

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with badge variant styles using cn() utility

params.name: variant
params.description: Visual variant style. Defaults to 'default' (primary blue background). 'outline' shows text only.

params.name: children
params.description: Content to display inside the badge (text, numbers, icons, etc.)

params.name: ...props
params.description: Standard HTML div attributes (id, data-*, onClick, etc.)

returns.description: A styled div element with badge classes and content

details.what_it_does: Renders a styled div element using badgeVariants for the specified variant. Merges variant classes with any additional className prop using cn(). Accepts all standard HTML div attributes which are spread onto the resulting element. Simple presentational component suitable for displaying status, labels, tags, or indicators.
details.rendered_ui_description: An inline-flex element with rounded corners, padding, small text (text-xs), and semibold font. Appearance depends on variant: default shows primary blue background with shadow, secondary shows secondary background, destructive shows red background with shadow, outline shows text-only (no background). All variants support hover state and focus ring styling.

extensive_correct.title: Badges with all variant styles

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using non-existent variant or passing invalid props
incorrect.why_incorrect: Badge variant must be one of: 'default', 'secondary', 'destructive', or 'outline'. Other values will be silently ignored by CVA and won't apply the correct styling. TypeScript will catch invalid variants if strict typing is enabled.
